title: TOURISM DEPARTMENT HOTUTE LEH COUNCIL OF CHURCHES IN MIZORAM TE INHMUKHAWM
content:
4074/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 20th of January, 2026:Vawiin chawhnu dar 1:00 khan Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar, Minister of State, Tourism Department hovin Tourism Department hotute leh Council of Churches in Mizoram (CCM) aiawhte chuan tunhnai Mizoram tourism chungchang thlirhovin MINECO, Aizawl a SAD Conference Hall II-ah an thukhawm.

Tourism Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan tunhnaiah Mizoram in khualzin a neih zat chu a pun nasat thu sawiin, "September thlaah Sairang thleng rel a lo lut a, a thla leh October thlaah Mizoram a khualzin lo lut zat chu mi sing kua a tling. Mizoram tlawhtu thahnem tak kan nei a, an la pun belh zel kan beisei bawk a, chumi tur pawh chuan Tourism Department lamin hma kan la bawk a ni. Chutihrual chuan kan ram a khualzin rawn pun belh hian nghawng a nei lo thei lova, khualzinte hian kan ram mawina leh nawmna te hmuh a hriat ve an duh a, chuvanga an rawn pun tak zelah chuan engtinnge kan lo dawnsawn ang tih kha ngaihtuah a ngai ta a ni." tiin Mizoram a kohhran hrang hrang hruaitute nena thutkhawm a ngaih chhan a sawi.

Pu Lalnghinglova chuan tourist te chu kan nunphung leh khawsak dan hre sa bik lova lo lut an ni a. Tourism chuan mi zawng zawng a nghawng avangin kohhran leh khawtlang hruaitu te, tlawmngai pawl te nen thawhhona tha tak nei a lo dawnsawn a ngai tih a sawi a. "December thla chhungin district pathum belh tel lovin khualzin mi nuai 1.1 chuang kan nei a, kan ramah hunpui kan hmanlaia lo kal chak te an ni a, nakin zelah pawh hetih hunlai hi khualzin tam hunlai tur a ni. Hei vang hian mipui lamah sensitisation leh awareness uar zawka kalpui zel kan tum. Kan lo dawnsawn dan tur mipuiten kan lo hriatthiam bakah eng chinah nge tihte pawh kan hriat a pawimawh.” a ti a. Biak In chu khualzinte tlawh chak zingah a tel a, Biak In chhunga awmdan tur leh inthuam dan tur thlenga mikhual lamin an hriat theihna tura hmalak dan leh, eng chinah nge an lo tel ang tihte sawiho a pawimawh hle a ni tiin, CCM nena hmalakho dan turte ngaihtuah a tul thu a sawi a ni.

Council of Churches in Mizoram lam pawhin Mizoram a khualzin pung chu lawmawm an tih thu leh Mizoram tlawhtu an pung chuan Kohhran pawh a nghawng tel thu an sawi a. Chuvangin Kohhran anga  ngaihtuahna sen a, hma lak tul an tih thu an sawi a ni.

Vawiina thutkhawm hi a bultanna leh sawihawnna huna hman a ni a. Hun remchang hmasaah ngun zawka thawhho dan tur ngaihtuah leh hmalakna awm thei tur hrang hrangte thlirhova thutkhawm leh nise tiin rel a ni. CCM lam pawhin hma lak an duhdan te ngaihtuahin lo thukhawm ve se tiin rel a ni bawk.

Vawiin thutkhawmah ah hian Council of Churches in Mizoram atangin President Rev. Dr. R. Lalbiakliana hovin an tel a. Tourism Department atangin Pi Lalsangpuii Hmar, Joint Secretary; Pi R. Lalrodingi, Director leh official dangte an tel bawk a ni.

title: Governor Interacts with Students Visiting Mizoram from Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Lakshadweep
content:
457/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 20th January, 2026:Mizoram Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh, PVSM, AVSM, YSM (Retd), interacted with 40 students and 4 teachers from Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Lakshadweep who are visiting Mizoram under the "Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme" at Durbar Hall, Lok Bhavan, this afternoon.

Governor General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh warmly welcomed the visiting students to Mizoram and encouraged them to utilise this opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of Northeast India. He highlighted that Mizoram, similar to Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Lakshadweep, is a sparsely populated region with scenic beauty, limited large-scale industries, and extensive forest cover, which contributes to its pleasant climate. He also noted that Mizoram is a fully literate state and is set to establish its own State University in line with the National Education Policy 2020.

The Governor mentioned that since the signing of the Mizoram Peace Accord in 1986, Mizoram has become one of the most peaceful states in India, with steady progress in development. He referred to the recent inauguration of the Bairabi-Sairang railway line last year and plans to extend railway connectivity to the southern tip of Mizoram, integrating it with the Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Transport Project (KMMTTP). He emphasised Mizoram's significant potential in agriculture, horticulture, and aromatic plants, stating that with improved supply chains and market linkages, it could lead to substantial economic growth. He extended his best wishes to the students for a memorable and productive stay in Mizoram.

The Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme is a key initiative by the Central Government under the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) aimed at promoting national integration. Through this programme, students from northeastern states and other parts of India engage in exchanges to learn about diverse cultures and traditions.

The group visiting Mizoram under the Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme arrived in the state on January 15, 2026. Based at Mizoram University during their stay, they will receive lectures from experts on various aspects of Northeast India's history and culture. They are scheduled to depart Mizoram on January 28, 2026.

title: Larsap-in Andaman and Nicobar Islands leh Lakshadweep atanga Mizoram rawn tlawhtu zirlaite a kawm
content:
4072/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 20th January, 2026:Mizoram Larsap General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh, PVSM, AVSM, YSM (Retd) chuan vawiin chawhnu khan "Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme" kaltlanga Mizoram rawn tlawhtu Andaman and Nicobar Islands leh Lakshadweep atanga zirlai 40 leh zirtirtu 4 te chu Durbar Hall, Lok Bhavan-ah a kawm.

Larsap General (Dr) Vijay Kumar Singh chuan Ashtalakshmi Darshan kaltlanga Mizoram rawn tlawhtu zirlaite chu thinlung taka a lo lawm thu sawiin, he hun hi India hmarchhak state-te hriat chian lehzual nana hman tum turin a fuih a. Mizoram chu an rawn kalna Andaman and Nicobar Islands leh Lakshadweep ang bawka mihring cheng tam lohna leh hmun mawi tak, industry lian awm lohna leh ramngaw nei tam a nih avanga sik leh sa nuam tak a nih thu a sawi a. Mizoram chu ziak leh chhiar thiam vekna state-a puan a nih thu sawiin, National Education Policy 2020 inkaihhruaina zulzuiin ama pual State University a neih dawn thu a sawi bawk.

Larsap chuan kum 1986-a Mizoram Peace Accord ziah a nih hnuah Mizoram chu India rama state ralmuang ber a nih thu sawiin, hmasawnna pawh chak taka kal chhoh mek zel thu a sawi a. Nikumah Bairabi-Sairang railway line hawn a nih thu sawiin, Mizoram chhim tawp thleng railway line siama Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Transport Project (KMMTTP) nena thlunzawm tum a nih thu a sawi a. Mizoram chuan agriculture, horticulture leh ram hmul damdawiahte theihna nasa tak a neih thu sawiin, supply chain leh hralhna tha a awm phawt chuan hmasawnna nasa zawk a thlen theih thu a sawi bawk a. Zirlaite chu Mizoram an cham chhunga hun hlimawm leh hlawkthlak tak hmang turin duhsakna a hlan a ni.

Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme hi hnam inpumkhatna chawilar nana Sawrkar laipui hmalakna pawimawh tak, DoNER Ministry hnuaia kalpui a ni a. Hemi programme hmang hian hmarchhak state zleh India ram hmun danga zirlaite chu hnam ziarang leh nunphungte zirin an intlawhpawh thin a ni.

Ashtalakshmi Darshan Youth Exchange Programme hmanga Mizoram rawn tlawhtute hian January ni 15, 2026 khan Mizoram an lo thleng a. Mizoram University-ah innghatin an cham chhung hian mithiam tak tak te'n North East India chanchin hrang hrang an zirtir dawn a. Ruahman dan chuan January ni 28, 2026 hian Mizoram an chhuahsan ang.

title: DM&R MINISTER PROF. LALNILAWMA GRACES CLOSING CEREMONY OF 5TH BATCH YUVA AAPDA MITRA TRAINING
content:
456/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 20th January 2026:The 5th Batch Training of Yuva Aapda Mitra, conducted under the joint initiative of the Disaster Management & Rehabilitation (DM&R) Department, Government of Mizoram, and the 1st Mizo Battalion, National Cadet Corps (NCC), formally concluded today at 10:00 a.m. at the Mizoram Scouts & Guides Training Centre, Tanhril, Aizawl. The training programme had commenced on 13 January 2026. Professor Lalnilawma, Hon’ble Minister, DM&R Department, attended the programme as the Chief Guest.

Addressing the gathering, the Minister lauded the close cooperation between the DM&R Department and the 1st Mizo Battalion NCC, Aizawl, in the areas of disaster prevention and response. He remarked that such coordination is commendable and assured that even stronger collaboration would be pursued in the days ahead. Prof. Lalnilawma observed that natural disasters do not occur by human will and are beyond human control, and that everyone is vulnerable to them. However, he emphasized that preparedness and advance planning before disasters strike are well within human capacity. He underlined the importance of learning appropriate disaster response techniques and stated that such knowledge is vital. The Minister also expressed appreciation for the noble spirit of service shown by the NCC cadets and volunteers, noting their willingness to step forward to respond to disasters and assist others when such situations arise.

The 5th Batch Training of Yuva Aapda Mitra was successfully completed by 112 NCC cadets drawn from nine colleges, namely: Govt. Mamit College, Govt. Kolasib College, Govt. Serchhip College, Lunglei Govt. College, Govt. Khawzawl College, Kamalanagar Govt. College, Govt. Siaha College, Hatim College, and Govt. J.B. College.

The Yuva Aapda Mitra Scheme aims to impart training to youth volunteers at the community level so that they can undertake immediate rescue and relief operations during disasters, even before external assistance reaches the affected areas. At present, the scheme’s training programmes are being implemented in the districts of Lunglei, Champhai, Kolasib, Serchhip, and Mamit. With the conclusion of today’s programme, a total of 531 youths belonging to NCC, NYKS, Bharat Scouts & Guides, and NSS have been trained so far under the scheme.

The closing ceremony was attended by Pu Udit Prakash Rai, Commissioner & Secretary, Pu Chuauhnuna, Director, and Pu Francis Lallawmkima, Joint Director (Operations) from the DM&R Department. From the NCC, Brigadier G.S. Arora, Lt. Col. Ranjit Chandel, along with other officials, were also present.

title: TRANSPORT MINISTER HOVIN MIZORAM STATE ROAD SAFETY COUNCIL THUTKHAWMAH ROAD SAFETY MONTH HMAN DAN TUR AN REL
content:
4066/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 20th January, 2026:Pu Vanlalhlana, Minister, Transport Department hovin vawiin khan SAD Conference Hall No. 2, MINECO, Khatlaah Mizoram State Road Safety Council chu thukhawmin, Road Safety Month hman dan tur an rel.

Minister Pu Vanlalhlana chuan hawnna thu sawiin, lirthei chungchanga dan kan neih that laiin, ‘road safety’ lama tan lak a ngaih thu a sawi a. India chu USA dawtah khawvela road network nei tha ber a ni a, km nuai 66 chuang a nei tih leh Mizoram kawngpui pawhin hma a sawn zel a, hmun hla anga ngaih thinte pawh hun rei lo te chhungin a thlen theih tawh tih a tarlang a. India rama road accident a pung chho zel tih leh hemi avanga thi leh hliam pawh an tam chhoh zel thu sawiin, he’ng accident zinga zaa 70 te chu lirthei khalh chak vang a ni, a ti a.

Minister chuan sawi zawmin, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH)-in a tarlan dan chuan kum 2024 khan accident tum 4,87,705 a thleng a, mi 1,77,177-te’n nunna chanin, mi 4,71,455-te’n hliam an tuar a; e-DAR atanga a lan danin Mizoramah nikum khan accident tum 73 a thleng a, mi 56-in nunna an chan a, mi 45-te’n hliam an tuar a ni, a ti a. Accident chuan mi tam tak nunna a lak mai piah lamah India ram hausakna pawh a nghawng a. MoRTH leh NITI Aayog-te chhut dan chuan kumtinin India GDP 2.5% atanga 3% thleng chu accident thlen avanga sensoah a hlohtir ziah thu a sawi bawk a.

Minister chuan sawrkar laipuiin ‘road safety’ a ngaih pawimawh thu leh khauh taka dan kenkawh a nih theih nan leh mipuite tana a awlsam zawk nan khawl thiamna hmanga kalpui a tum chhoh zel thu sawiin, lirthei fitness endik te, license exam, lirthei register, insurance leh thil dangah a duh strict tial tial bakah e-enforcement hawi zawngin hma lam kan pan zel a ni, tih a sawi bawk.

Thutkhawmah hian Road Safety Month chu February 2026-a hman tura rel a ni a. Thupui thlan sa, ‘Sadak Suraksha Jeevan Raksha (Road Safety Life Safety)’ tih chu hman tur niin, February ni 2, 2026-ah a hawnna hun hman tura rel a ni a. District tinah Police Department-te nena tanghovin MV Act mila Special Enforcement Drive neih tur a ni a. Zirna in leh sawrkar pisa hrang hrangah Road Safety Pledge chham tura rel a nih bakah, Police leh Transport Department-a thawktute’n kawngpui hmangtute, sikul naupangte leh lirthei khalhtute tan traffic dan leh dun chungchangah te, lirthei chetsualnaa inbawihsawm dan tur te leh bawihsawmtute thubuai laka an himna tur dan (Good Samaritan Law) chungchang te hrilhhriatna hun hmanpui tura rel a ni a.

Road Safety Month-ah hian district tinin MyBharat Portal-ah he thla chhunga lirthei chetsualna thleng zat, hliam zat leh nunna chan zat kum hmasa nena khaikhinna an thehlut tur a ni a, mipuite chu mygov.in portal-a Road Safety Competition-a tel theuh tura sawm an ni bawk. ‘Road safety’ chungchanga mipuite hriat tur pawimawh zau zawka thehdarh dan tur rel niin, he’ng bakah hian lirthei thenkhata bullbar (bumper guard) vuah thin chu midangte tan a him lohzia leh pollution check dana hmasawn ngaihna lai te, MoRTH tanpuina hmanga driver training centre (DTC) din theih a ni tih mipuite hnena thehdarh a ngaih thu te sawiho a ni bawk.

Vawiin thutkhawmah hian Pu C. Lalruaia, Secretary, Transport Department bakah Transport Department official-te leh PWD, H&FW, Planning, UD&PA, Finance, H&TE, School Education, ICT Department leh AMC aiawhte an tel a ni.

title: Health Minister Pi Lalrinpuii’n Christ University, Bangalore ah North East Hmathlir chungchang sawihona International Conference hmanpui
content:
4061/2025-2026

BENGALURU, January 20, 2026 –Christ University buatsaih - Libernum 2026 - International Conference on Northeast India at the Crossroad:Inclusion, culture and a sustainable future" neih mek chu Health Minister Pi Lalrinpuii chuan Khuallian (Chief Guest) niin a hmanpui a. He hunah hian India ram chhung leh khawvel hmun hrang hrang atanga University professor thahnem tak leh mithiam rualte an tel a ni.

Minister chuan ṭhalaite hnenah North East chu 'Landlocked' ti a sawi tawh lova, 'Land-linked' tia sawi tawh turin a chah. Agartala-Akhaura rail kawng te, Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit leh Asian Highway te avangin kawng engkimah kalpawhna a ṭha tawh hle a ni a ti a.

Kan hnam nunphung leh culture te chu museum-a dah ṭhat mai mai tur a ni tawh lova, khawvel economy inelna sang takah hian 'Intellectual Property' hlu tak a ni tawh zawk a ni. Kan puancheite leh kan ram hnim damdawi te hi khawvel mamawh, a hlutna sang tak a ni tawh tih a sawi bawk.

Digital Democracy leh Inrelbawlna Technology chungchang sawi telin, 4G leh 5G ṭhan chhoh zelna zarah, Mizoram kilkhawr bera cheng zirlai te leh Bengaluru-a awm ten thiamna leh hriatna inang an dawng thei tawh a. Hei hi 'Inclusive Governance' dik tak chu a ni, a ti a ni.

Tin, Hmasawnna leh hriselna chu damdawi in tam lam ringawt ni lovin, mahni rama awm a, eizawnna ngelnghet neih theihna hi a ni a ti a. Aizawl aṭanga London thlenga thil thawn chhuak thei ṭhalai entrepreneur te hi hmasawnna dik tak chu an ni a ti a.

Tin, North East chu India ram boruak thianghlim petu a nih avangin, hmasawnna kan kalpui dan pawh a danglam a ngai a. Eco-tourism te, Carbon credits te leh energy thianghlim hmanga hma lakna chu North East innghahna tur a nih thu a sawi bawk.

He conference-ah hian Mizoram atanga AI lama hma latu LushAITech pawh Christ University nen thawk hovin 'AI Partner' angin an tel ve bawk a ni.

title: Awareness Programme on PM Vishwakarma Scheme Held at Serchhip
content:
455/2025-2026

20th January, 2026 :An awareness programme on the Prime Minister Vishwakarma Scheme was held today at Pisapui Hall, Deputy Commissioner’s Office, Serchhip. Deputy Commissioner Pu Paul L. Khuma attended the programme as the Chief Guest.

Addressing the gathering, DC Pu Paul L. Khuma stated that God has endowed human beings with unique talents and skills, and the PM Vishwakarma Scheme has been designed to enable people to earn a better livelihood by utilising their God-given craftsmanship. He observed that in today’s rapidly changing world, there is a growing appreciation for locally produced, traditional crafts grounded in culture and tradition, as opposed to reliance on externally sourced products. He emphasised the need for individuals to become more self-reliant and to further develop their skills in order to secure sustainable livelihoods.

The Deputy Commissioner also urged participants to spread awareness about the scheme among their friends and others engaged in similar trades. Speaking on the issue of loans, he advised beneficiaries to repay loans obtained under government schemes sincerely and on time, cautioning that failure to do so could adversely affect not only their own future loan prospects but also those of others.

Pu Samrat M. Jha, Assistant Director Grade-I (in-charge), Branch MSME, Mizoram State, delivered the welcome address and explained the objectives of the PM Vishwakarma Scheme. He highlighted that the scheme aims to support India’s traditional artisans and craftspeople by enabling them to use their age-old skills as viable means of livelihood and to improve their socio-economic conditions.

Others who spoke during the programme included Pu Lalnghawrliana, Lead District Manager; Pi Zirthangpuii, Domain Expert, PM Vishwakarma, Serchhip District; Pu Lalhmangaihtluanga, District Level Resource Person (DLRP), Serchhip District Commerce & Industries; and Pi Vanlalmawii, Executive, India Posts Payment Bank (IPPB).

The PM Vishwakarma Scheme is a Central Sector Scheme implemented under the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME), Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE), and Department of Financial Services (DFS). In Mizoram, the scheme is implemented by the Department of Commerce & Industries.

Under the scheme, one eligible member from a non-government employed family, aged 18 years and above and possessing traditional skills, can register. The scheme is not meant for learning new trades, but is specifically designed for those already skilled in any of the 18 traditional trades recognised by the Central Government. Registered beneficiaries are provided with skill upgradation training, support for improved livelihood opportunities, exposure to digital marketing, and financial literacy training. They are also eligible for low-interest loans up to ₹3 lakh and are provided essential toolkits, such as masonry tools, free of cost.

Pu Samrat M. Jha, Assistant Director Gr-I i/c Br. MSME, Mizoram State bialtu chuan kalkhawmte lawmna thu sawiin, PM Vishwakarma Scheme chungchang a sawifiah a. India ram mipuiten hmasang atanga thiam thil an lo neih tawh, kutthemthiamna chi hrang hrang chu eizawnna tlaka hmang tur leh, an khawsak dinhmun chawikan a nih theih nana duan a nih thu a sawi a ni.

Vawiin programme-ah hian Lead District Manager Pu Lalnghawrliana; Pi Zirthangpuii, Domain Expert, PMV, Serchhip District; Pu Lalhmangaihtluanga, DLRP, Serchhip District Commerce & Industries leh Pi Vanlalmawii, Executive, India Posts Payment Bank (IPPB) te pawhin thu an sawi a ni.

Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSME), Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship (MSDE) leh Department of Financial Services (DFS) hnuaia kalpui PM Vishwakarma hi Central Sector Scheme a ni a. Mizoramah chuan Commerce & Industries Department-in an enkawl a ni. He scheme hnuaiah hian kum 18 tling tawh, kutthemthiam, sawrkar hnathawk ni lo chhungkua atangin mi pakhat theuh inziahluh theih a ni a. Thiam thil zir thar tur te tan ni loin, Sawrkar Laipuiin a pawm traditional trade 18 a tarlan zinga a engemaw bera thiamna nei sa te tana buatsaih a ni a. He scheme a inziaklutte hi an thiamna tipung tur te, eizawnna hlawk zawk an neih theih nan te, internet kaltlanga sumdawn dan (digital marketing) inkawhhmuh nan te leh sum leh pai pei pun dan an thiam theih nan training pek thin an ni a. A pung hniam zawkin Loan cheng nuai thum thleng an lak theih bakah eizawnna bungraw pawimawh (mistiri bungrua etc) a thlawna pek an ni bawk.
